text: Just as courage imperils life; fear protects it.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: The eye sees a thing more clearly in dreams than the imagination awake.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Men of lofty genius when they are doing the least work are most active.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: He who does not punish evil commands it to be done.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Water is the driver of Nature.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: When once you have tasted flight, you will forever walk the earth with your eyes turned skyward, for there you have been, and there you will always long to return.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Lust is the cause of generation.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: The greatest deception men suffer is from their own opinions.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Common sense is that which judges the things given to it by other senses.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Who sows virtue reaps honor.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Every now and then go away, have a little relaxation, for when you come back to your work your judgment will be surer. Go some distance away because then the work appears smaller and more of it can be taken in at a glance and a lack of harmony and proportion is more readily seen.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: He who truly knows has no occasion to shout.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Once you have tasted flight, you will forever walk the earth with your eyes turned skyward, for there you have been, and there you will always long to return.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Obstacles cannot crush me. Every obstacle yields to stern resolve. He who is fixed to a star does not change his mind.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Tears come from the heart and not from the brain.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: A well-spent day brings happy sleep.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Simplicity is the ultimate form of sophistication.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Iron rusts from disuse even so does inaction sap the vigor of the mind.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Painting is concerned with all the 10 attributes of sight; which are: Darkness, Light, Solidity and Colour, Form and Position, Distance and Propinquity, Motion and Rest.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Water is the driving force of all nature.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: I am still hopeful. A falcon, Time. But the coincidence is probably accidental.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: You can have no dominion greater or less than that over yourself
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: A painter should begin every canvas with a wash of black, because all things in nature are dark except where exposed by the light.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Art is never finished, only abandoned.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Painting is poetry that is seen rather than felt, and poetry is painting that is felt rather than seen.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: For once you have tasted flight you will walk the earth with your eyes turned skywards, for there you have been and there you will long to return.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Time stays long enough for anyone who will use it.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: There shall be wings! If the accomplishment be not for me, it's for some other.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: A diamond is just a lump of coal that stuck to its job.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: In rivers, the water that you touch is the last of what has passed and the first of that which comes, so with time present.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: It had long since come to my attention that people of accomplishment rarely sat back and let things happen to them. They went out and happened to things.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Practice should always be based upon a sound knowledge of theory.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: The human foot is a masterpiece of engineering and a work of art.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Iron rusts from disuse; water loses its purity from stagnation even so does inaction sap the vigor of the mind.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Anyone who conducts an argument by appealing to authority is not using his intelligence, he is just using his memory.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Once you have tasted the taste of sky, you will forever look up.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Marriage is like putting your hand into a bag of snakes in the hope of pulling out an eel.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: A deaf and dumb person who sees two men in conversation may nevertheless understand from the attitudes and gestures of the speakers, how well their discussion is getting along.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: The boundaries of bodies are the least of all things.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: The first step towards getting somewhere is to decide that you are not going to stay where you are.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Medicine is the restoration of discordant elements; sickness is the discord of the elements infused into the living body.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: The greatest deception which men incur proceeds from their opinions.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Wood feeds the fire which burns it.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Inequality is the cause of all local movements.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Nothing strengthens authority so much as silence.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: A gray day provides the best light.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: A long life is a life well spent.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: The motive power is the cause of all life.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Every action needs to be prompted by a motive. To know and to will are two operations of the human mind. Discerning, judging, deliberating are acts of the human mind.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Beyond a doubt truth bears the same relation to falsehood as light to darkness.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: All the bystanders at an event worthy of note adopt various gestures of admiration when contemplating the occurrence.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: He who possesses most must be most afraid of loss.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: A wave is never found alone, but is mingled with the other waves.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: It is useful to constantly observe, note, and consider.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Poor is the pupil who does not surpass his master.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Intellectual passion drives out sensuality.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Even the richest soil, if left uncultivated will produce the rankest weeds.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: We might say that the earth has the spirit of growth; that its flesh is the soil.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Why does the eye see a thing more clearly in dreams than the imagination when awake?
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Iron rusts from disuse; water loses its purity from stagnation... even so does inaction sap the vigor of the mind.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Shadows which you see with difficulty, and whose boundaries you cannot define... these you should not represent as finished or sharply defined, for the result would be that your work would seem wooden.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Learn diligence before speedy execution
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: The grave will fall in upon him who digs it.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Studying without desire spoils the memory and it retains nothing that it takes in.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Just as iron rusts from disuse, even so does inaction spoil the intellect.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: The human bird shall take his first flight, filling the world with amazement, all writings with his fame, and bringing eternal glory to the nest whence he sprang.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: I woke up only to find the rest of the world asleep.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: The length of a man's outspread arms is equal to his height.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Experiment is the sole interpreter of the artifices of Nature.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: As a well-spent day brings happy sleep, so a life well used brings happy death.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Never let your sense of morals prevent you from doing what's right.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: I have been impressed with the urgency of doing. Knowing is not enough; we must apply. Being willing is not enough; we must do.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Fix your course on a star and then you'll navigate any storm.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: I love those who can smile in trouble, who can gather strength from distress, and grow brave by reflection. 'Tis the business of little minds to shrink, but they whose heart is firm, and whose conscience approves their conduct, will pursue their principles unto death.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Learning never exhausts the mind.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Theory without practice cannot survive and dies as quickly as it lives. He who loves practice without theory is like the sailor who boards ship without a rudder and compass and never knows where he may be cast.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Just as a good day's work leads to pleasant sleep, so a life well-spent leads to a pleasant death.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Water is the driving force in nature.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: I love those that can smile in trouble.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Mechanics is the paradise of the mathematical sciences because by means of it, one comes to the fruits of mathematics.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: All our knowledge is the offspring of our perceptions.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Ask for advise from those who evidence good self-discipline.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: He who does not control his impulse classes himself with beasts.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: The sun has body, form, motion, radiance, heat, and procreative power, and these things flow from the sun without diminishing it.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: The motion of the elements originates in the sun.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: The eye and the rays of the sun and the mind are the fastest motion there is.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: The smallest feline is a masterpiece.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: One can have no smaller or greater mastery than mastery of oneself.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Details make perfection, and perfection is not a detail.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: The mind that engages in subjects of too great variety becomes confused and weakened.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: I have been impressed with the urgency of doing. Knowing is not enough we must apply. Being willing is not enough; we must do.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Whoever despises the high wisdom of mathematics nourishes himself on delusion.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Oysters open completely when the moon is full; and when the crab sees one it throws a piece of stone or seaweed into it and the oyster cannot close again so that it serves the crab for meat. Such is the fate of him who opens his mouth too much and thereby puts himself at the mercy of the listener.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: Being willing is not enough. We must do.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci
